items.name: Koto
items.description: Traditional Japanese plucked zither used in gagaku and modern ensembles.

items.name: Djembe
items.description: Hand drum widely used in West African musical traditions.

items.name: Didgeridoo
items.description: Wind instrument developed by Aboriginal Australian peoples.

items.name: Sitar
items.description: Long-necked plucked lute used in Hindustani classical music.

items.name: Mbira (thumb piano)
items.description: Lamellophone used in Shona and related musical traditions.

items.name: Oud
items.description: Short-necked fretless lute, ancestor to many European lutes.

items.name: Uilleann pipes
items.description: Irish bagpipe played with bellows; central to traditional Irish music.

items.name: Nyckelharpa
items.description: Swedish keyed bowed string instrument with sympathetic strings.

items.name: Bandoneon
items.description: Free-reed instrument strongly associated with tango ensembles.

items.name: Erhu
items.description: Two-stringed bowed instrument used in Chinese classical and folk music.

items.name: Marimba
items.description: Keyboard percussion instrument with resonator tubes; prominent in Central American traditions.

items.name: Guqin
items.description: Seven-string plucked zither; associated with Chinese literati traditions.
sources: UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage (guqin art): https://ich.unesco.org
